thread.title: Comic Relief viewers disgusted as Vic Reeves flashes 'penis' pre-watershed but Ed Sheeran isn't allowed to talk about rape
thread.title_full: Comic Relief viewers disgusted as Vic Reeves flashes 'penis' pre-watershed but Ed Sheeran isn't allowed to talk about rape

author: mirror
title: Comic Relief viewers disgusted as Vic Reeves flashes 'penis' pre-watershed but Ed Sheeran isn't allowed to talk about rape
text:
Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Comic Relief viewers were left disgusted as Vic Reeves flashed his 'penis' pre-watershed but Ed Sheeran wasn't allowed to talk about child rape. 
In scenes viewers branded "cringe", comics Vic and Bob Mortimer were interviewing GMB presenter Susanna Reid when it all took a rather odd turn. 
After asking Susanna to comment on her toilet habits the pair then went on to question if she had seen Kong - presumably a reference to the blockbuster movie. But as the audience started to feel for Susanna it all went very wrong. Vic and Bob were playing "the stots" as they cringe interviewed Susanna (Photo: BBC) We all felt for the GMB presenter (Photo: BBC) 
Bob opened his legs and said: "It’s out there. It’s quite long, have you seen it? It’s very long and heavy at the end with a twist in the middle and at the beginning there’s a couple of little clackers. 
"It’s quite hairy at the beginning. You’ll probably miss it." 
Red-faced Susanna laughed off the crude joke - but many viewers didn't see the funny side. 
One mum fumed: "We have turned off. At 8.55pm Vic & Bob are on # disgusting sad for my children who were looking forward to this 
Another added: "And now it's 'we were funny once' Vic and Bob. Sorry, but this is so, so poor." Ed Sheeran fluffed his lines (Photo: BBC) 
"Ed isn't allowed to mention the brutality of child rape but these two get their Kong's out," ranted another. 
It comes as Comic Relief bosses raised more than £71 million after wowing film fans with a Love Actually sequel . 
Lovers of the hit 2003 movie stayed at home to see the 12-minute follow-up from screenwriter Richard Curtis. 
They also saw Ed Sheeran feel the pressure of live TV, when he forgot the lyrics to new track What Do I Know? 
But the 26-year-old simply laughed off the blunder and carried on. Read More 
Red Nose Day on Friday raised a total of £71,308,475 with more donations coming in by the minute. 
An updated figure will be released on Sunday, organisers said. Andrew Lincoln was back with his cue cards (Photo: Comic Relief Ltd) 
The mini-film opened with Andrew Lincoln’s character Mark knocking on Juliet’s (Keira Knightley) door as per the original, holding his infamous cards. 
After asking if his former crush liked his beard – she didn’t – he reminded her of his plans to marry one of four famous women, including Kate Moss. 
To Juliet’s surprise, he held up a sign saying, “Well I did” and to everyone’s shock, the supermodel then appeared. “Meet the wife” said Mark’s sign, with an arrow, while Kate’s read, “Hi, Nice to meet you”. Mark married Kate Moss (Photo: BBC) 
The scene then revealed Juliet was still happily married to husband Peter (Chiwetel Ejiofor), who was inside watching the TV. 
Mark suggested they find out what happened to the rest of their friends and the footage cut to Hugh Grant, resuming his role as Prime Minister David. Instead of dancing to Jump, like in the first movie, he busted some moves to Drake’s Hotline Bling in one of the funniest moments from the reunion. Read More Love Actually viewers agree the sequel for Red Nose Day was 'just what the country needs right now' Hugh Grant and Martine McCutcheon reprised their role as Prime Minister David and Natalie (Photo: BBC) 
Bill Nighy’s character Billy Mack was then seen during a radio interview talking about today’s music, but finally gave an honest answer when asked where his long suffering manager Joe (Gregor Fisher) was. Billy revealed Joe had died, after a “big heart attack, big coffin, left a big whole in my heart”. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
